meanings.sent1: The cow will calve in the spring.
meanings.sent2: The farmer watched the cow calve a healthy calf.
meanings.sent3: The cow decided to calve right in the middle of the field, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The mother cow seemed to effortlessly calve her newborn into the world.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the cow calving echoed through the barnyard.

meanings.definition: To break off as a glacier or iceberg.
meanings.sent1: The glacier began to calve large chunks of ice into the ocean.
meanings.sent2: Visitors to the Arctic witnessed the glacier calve spectacularly.
meanings.sent3: The glacier seemed to calve icebergs at the most inconvenient times.
meanings.sent4: The ice calved off the glacier with a thunderous roar.
meanings.sent5: The calving glacier created a breathtaking display of nature's power.
